key_points.text:
Disney’s ‘Lilo & Stitch’ becomes Hollywood’s first $1 billion movie of 2025
Positive Sentiment:
Jim Cramer endorsement—CNBC’s Jim Cramer labeled DIS a “very good long-term holding,” citing its strong movie slate and recent rally.

Jim Cramer Thinks Disney is a “Very Good Long-Term Holding”
Neutral Sentiment:
Earnings preview ahead—Analysts are setting expectations for Disney’s Q3 results on August 5, with emphasis on subscriber growth, ad revenue trends and park performance.
Earnings Preview: What To Expect From Walt Disney's
‘Lilo & Stitch’ crosses $1B—Disney’s live‐action blockbuster became the first Hollywood film of 2025 to exceed $1 billion at the global box office, underscoring the company’s content strength.
The Walt Disney Company (NYSE: DIS) shares have climbed recently, underpinned by profitable streaming results, strong box‐office performance and bullish analyst commentary.

Positive Sentiment:
Streaming turnaround bolsters recovery—DIS’s streaming segment turned profitable for the first time, fueling a 43% rally over the past three months and spurring multiple analyst price‐target raises.
